document.docAuthor: Kment, Petr, Jindra, Zdeněk & Rider, David A.
document.masterDocTitle: New synonymies and new records of Afrotropical and Madagascan Pentatominae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Pentatomidae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: New synonymies and new records of Afrotropical and Madagascan Pentatominae (Hemiptera: Heteroptera: Pentatomidae)

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Agonoscelis brachyptera
Schaum, 1853
: 357
(description, faunistics). Syntype (s): Mozambique ( ZMHB ?).

Strachia Wahlbergi
Stål, 1854
: 220
(description, faunistics): Syntype (s): South Africa : ‘Habitat in tractibus fluvii Limpopo’ [= in arcs of the river Limpopo] ( NHRS ). Synonymised by
Stål ( 1865 : 181 )
with a question mark, but treated as valid species by
Stål ( 1876 : 85 )
, syn. restit.

Agonoscelis brachyptera :
Schaum ( 1862 )
: 37−38 , Pl. II:
Fig. 2
(redescription, figure of habitus).

Afrania Wahlbergi
:
Stål ( 1865 )
: 180
−181 (redescription, new combination, new synonymy, faunistics);
Walker ( 1867 a)
: 234
(catalog, faunistics).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Sala colorata
Walker, 1867 b
: 405 (description). Syntypes ( 2 unsexed specimens): ‘E. Africa. Presented by Earl Russell’ ( BMNH ). Synonymised by
Distant ( 1900 b: 390 )
.

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Afrania Wahlbergii
(incorrect subsequent spelling):
Stål ( 1876 )
: 60
, 85 (key to genera, catalog).

Afrania Wahlbergi
:
Lethierry & Severin ( 1893 )
: 151
(catalog);
Distant ( 1898 )
: 297
, 306, 311 (faunistics);
Distant ( 1900 b)
: 390
(new synonymy);
Distant ( 1900 c)
: 434
(new synonymy).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Sala colorata
:
Lethierry & Severin ( 1893 )
: 207 (catalog);
Distant ( 1900 b)
: 390 (new synonymy);
Distant ( 1900 c)
: 434 (new synonymy).

paragraph.treatmentCitationGroup:
Afrania Wahlbergi
: Schouteden ( 1909 ): 56 (listed);
Jeannel ( 1913 )
: 39
(distribution);
Schumacher ( 1913 )
: 55
(faunistics);
Courteaux ( 1922 )
: 269
(faunistics).

Distribution. Angola (
Schumacher 1913 , as ‘ Angola : Sumpfgebiet des Maschi von Sambala bis Ra-unga [= marshland of Maschi (= Kwando river)
environs from Sambala to Ra-unga (?= Rundu)’], Botswana ( new record ), Democratic Republic of the Congo : Katanga ( new record ), Kenya (
Courteaux 1922
), Malawi (
Distant 1898 ; this paper
), Mozambique (
Schaum 1853
, 1862 ; this paper), Namibia (
Schumacher 1913 , as ‘Deutsche Sambesigebiet’
), South Africa (
Stål 1865
,
Walker 1867 a
,
Distant 1898
; this paper), Tanzania : Tanganyika, Zanzibar ( new record ), Uganda ( new record ), Zambia (
Schumacher 1913 , as ‘West-Barothe [= Western Barotseland]’; this paper
), Zimbabwe (
Distant 1889
, 1898 ; this paper).

Note.
Agonoscelis brachyptera
was briefly described by
Schaum ( 1853 )
from Mozambique ; detailed description and colour figure of habitus were published later by
Schaum ( 1862 )
. Stål’s description of
Strachia Wahlbergi
from South Africa , Limpopo Province, though published with year 1853 , actually appeared a year later (
Stål 1854 : 220
).
Stål ( 1865 : 181 )
treated
Agonoscelis brachyptera
as a synonym of
Afrania wahlbergi
with a question mark, but
Stål ( 1876 : 85 )
listed
Afrania brachyptera
as a valid species without any comment.
Lethierry & Severin ( 1893 )
and
Kirkaldy ( 1909 )
catalogued
Afrania wahlbergi Stål
, considered as published in 1853 , with
Afrania brachyptera Schaum
as its junior synonym, because attributed to
Schaum ( 1862 )
, not to
Schaum ( 1853 )
.
Robertson ( 2009 )
listed ‘
Strachia wahlbergi Stål, 1853
’ and ‘
Agonoscelis brachyptera
Schaum, 1853
’ as its junior synonym. With respect to the principle of priority,
Afrania brachyptera (
Schaum, 1853
)
, stat. restit., must be considered the valid name for the species, with
Afrania wahlbergi (
Stål, 1854
)
, syn. restit., being its junior synonym.
